00054 shapeInfo::shapeInfo()
00055 {
00056 
00057         //tolerances for grouping (binning) arcs
00058         pointTol = Precision::Confusion();
00059         radiusTol = Precision::Confusion();
00060         ax1AngTol = Precision::Angular();
00061         ax1LinTol = Precision::Confusion();
00062 
00063         //set up menus, signals
00064         myMenu = new QMenu ( "Shape" );
00065         theWindow->menuBar()->insertMenu ( theWindow->getHelpMenu(),myMenu );
00066 
00067         infoAction = new QAction ( "Shape &Info", this );
00068         infoAction->setShortcut ( QString ( "Ctrl+I" ) );
00069         infoAction->setStatusTip ( "Shape Info" );
00070         connect ( infoAction, SIGNAL ( triggered() ), this, SLOT ( infoButton() ) );
00071         myMenu->addAction ( infoAction );
00072 
00073         countAction = new QAction ( "Arc Count", this );
00074         //countAction->setShortcut(QString("Ctrl+I"));
00075         countAction->setStatusTip ( "Counts the number of arcs in a solid, groups them based on radius and centerpoint" );
00076         connect ( countAction, SIGNAL ( triggered() ), this, SLOT ( countArcs() ) );
00077         myMenu->addAction ( countAction );
00078 
00079         canAction = new QAction ( "Canned cycle from hole face", this );
00080         //countAction->setShortcut(QString("Ctrl+I"));
00081         countAction->setStatusTip ( "Generates a line of g-code for a canned cycle for a hole,\nfrom a selected cylindrical face" );
00082         connect ( canAction, SIGNAL ( triggered() ), this, SLOT ( canFace() ) );
00083         myMenu->addAction ( canAction );
00084 
00085 };

00088 //looks like BRepAdaptor_Surface can do this stuff
00089 // too bad I didn't notice BEFORE writing a 100-line function...
00090 void shapeInfo::canFace()
00091 {
00092         TopExp_Explorer Ex;
00093         BRepAdaptor_Curve adaptor;
00094         TopoDS_Edge e;
00095 //      gp_Pnt p1, p2, c;
00096 //      gp_Ax1 axis;
00097 //      Standard_Real r;
00098         std::vector<anArc> arcsV;
00099 
00100         getSelection();
00101         for ( uint i=0;i < selectedShapes.size();i++ )
00102         {
00103                 TopoDS_Shape S = selectedShapes[i];
00104                 TopoDS_Face cylFace = TopoDS::Face ( S );
00105                 for ( Ex.Init ( cylFace, TopAbs_EDGE ) ; Ex.More() ; Ex.Next() )
00106                 {
00107                         e = TopoDS::Edge(Ex.Current());
00108                         adaptor.Initialize ( e );
00109                         if ( adaptor.GetType() ==GeomAbs_Circle )
00110                         {
00111                                 anArc thisArc;
00112                                 gp_Circ circ = adaptor.Circle();
00113                                 thisArc.c = circ.Location();
00114                                 thisArc.r = circ.Radius();
00115                                 thisArc.ax = circ.Axis();
00116                                 arcsV.push_back(thisArc);
00117                         }
00118                 }
00119                 infoMsg(QString("Number of arcs: %1").arg(arcsV.size()));
00120                 //now compare arcs, must have at least 2 arcs
00121                 bool foundMatch = false;
00122                 uint multipleMatch = 0;
00123                 anArc a,b;
00124                 for ( int j = 0; j < int(arcsV.size())-1; j++) //wtf not the same as uintj=0;j<arcsV.size()-1
00125                 {
00126                         anArc arc1 = arcsV[j];
00127                         for ( uint k = j+1; k < arcsV.size(); k++)
00128                         {
00129                                 anArc arc2 = arcsV[k];
00130                                 if (    (arc1.ax.IsCoaxial(arc2.ax, ax1AngTol, ax1LinTol)) && 
00131                                         (abs(arc1.r - arc2.r) < radiusTol) )
00132                                 { //we have a match
00133                                         if ( foundMatch )
00134                                         { //not the first match
00135                                                 if( !( a.ax.IsCoaxial(arc2.ax, ax1AngTol, ax1LinTol) && (abs(a.r - arc2.r) < radiusTol) ) ) 
00136                                                 { //not on same cylinder as a,b
00137                                                         if(!multipleMatch)  //tell user only once
00138                                                                 infoMsg("Warning - more than 2 arcs are coaxial.");
00139                                                         multipleMatch++;
00140                                                 } else {
00141                                                         //TODO: check against a,b; if arc1 or arc2 is outside a,b then replace a,b
00142                                                 }
00143                                         } else {
00144                                                 foundMatch = true;
00145                                                 a = arc1; b = arc2;
00146                                         }
00147                                 }
00148                                 
00149                         }
00150                 }
00151                 if (multipleMatch)
00152                         cout << "multipleMatch: " << multipleMatch << endl;
00153                 if (foundMatch) 
00154                 {
00155                         //a, b contain the data
00156                         //G81 X- Y- Z- A- B- C- R- L-
00157                         //G90 G81 G98 X4 Y5 Z1.5 R2.8
00158                         //http://www.linuxcnc.org/docs/html/gcode_main.html#sub:G81:-Drilling-Cycle
00159                         QString block, comment;
00160                         gp_Pnt top, bottom;
00161                         if (a.c.Z() > b.c.Z()) {
00162                                 top = a.c;      //top of the hole
00163                                 bottom = b.c;
00164                         } else {
00165                                 top = b.c;
00166                                 bottom = a.c;
00167                         }
00168                         block = "G90 G81 G98 ";
00169                         block += toNC(bottom); //adds XYZ
00170                         if ( !a.ax.Direction().IsEqual( gp_Dir(0,0,1), ax1AngTol ))
00171                         {
00172                                 //print coords for A,B
00173                                 //TODO: not sure if this is correct
00174                                 Standard_Real A,B;
00175                                 gp_Dir d;
00176                                 d = a.ax.Direction();
00177                                 A = (180.0/M_PI) * fixAngle( atan2l( d.Y(), d.Z() ));
00178                                 B = (180.0/M_PI) * fixAngle( atan2l( d.X(), d.Z() ));
00179                                 block += toNC("A", A) + toNC("B", B);
00180                                 comment += "Angles are in degrees; ";
00181                         } else comment += "Omitting AB: hole is vertical; ";
00182                         block += toNC("R",top.Z());
00183                         comment += QString("Tool diameter %1").arg( a.r * 2.0 );
00184                         infoMsg("Canned cycle G81\n"+block+" ("+comment+")");
00185                 } else {
00186                         infoMsg("Must select a face that is a section of a\n" 
00187                                 "cylinder.  Could not find a pair of arcs that\n" 
00188                                 "were coaxial and had the same radius.");
00189                 }
00190         }
00191 }
00192 
00193 /**********************************************************************************
00194 **  "Fix" an angle:
00195 **  put it in 1st or 4th quadrant if it is in 3rd or 2nd quadrant, respectively
00196 **  make the angle zero if it is close to a multiple of pi.
00197 **********************************************************************************/
00198 Standard_Real shapeInfo::fixAngle(Standard_Real a) 
00199 {
00200         Standard_Real sign = signbit(a) ? -1 : 1;
00201         a = fabs(a);                    //makes it soooo much easier
00202         if ( fmod(a, M_PI) < ax1AngTol)  //very close to a multiple of pi
00203                 a = 0.0; 
00204         while (a > M_PI/2.0 + ax1AngTol)  //result should be in quadrant 1 or 4
00205                 a = a - M_PI;
00206         
00207         return (a*sign);                //restore sign bit
00208 }

00210 //formats X,Y,Z for a RS274NGC block
00211 QString shapeInfo::toNC(gp_Pnt p)
00212 {
00213         QString s;
00214         s = toNC("X",p.X()) + toNC("Y",p.Y()) + toNC("Z",p.Z());
00215         //s.sprintf("X%#.7f Y%#.7f Z%#.7f",p.X(),p.Y(),p.Z());
00216         return s;
00217 }
00218 
00219 //Formats number for part of a RS274NGC block, preceding it with letter.
00220 //if number == last, don't print anything
00221 QString shapeInfo::toNC(const char *letter, Standard_Real number, Standard_Real last)
00222 {
00223         QString s = "";
00224         if(number != last) s.sprintf("%c%#5f ",*letter, number);
00225         return s;
00226 
00227 }

00229 void shapeInfo::countArcs()
00230 {
00231         getSelection();  //puts selection into the vector uiStuff::selectedShapes
00232         for ( uint i=0;i < selectedShapes.size();i++ )
00233         {
00234 //              infoMsg("solid");
00235                 TopoDS_Shape S = selectedShapes[i];
00236 //              checkShapeType(S);
00237                 arcCount ( TopoDS::Solid ( S ) );
00238         }
00239         printBinningResults(); //message user or save text file? either?
00240 }

00243 //use "bins" to group arcs
00244 //when comparing values to determine the bin, use Precision::Confusion or other value, so that these truly are the bins used in sadistics.
00245 //  OCC Doxygen: ReferenceDocumentation/FoundationClasses/html/classPrecision.html
00246 void shapeInfo::arcCount ( TopoDS_Solid theShape )
00247 {
00248         TopExp_Explorer Ex;
00249         BRepAdaptor_Curve adaptor;
00250         TopoDS_Edge e;
00251         gp_Pnt p1, p2;
00252         gp_Ax1 axis;
00253         Standard_Real r;
00254 
00255 
00256 
00257 
00258         for ( Ex.Init ( theShape, TopAbs_EDGE ) ; Ex.More() ; Ex.Next() )
00259         {
00260                 e = TopoDS::Edge(Ex.Current());  //FIXME: correct?
00261                 adaptor.Initialize ( e );
00262                 if ( adaptor.GetType() ==GeomAbs_Circle )
00263                 {
00264                         gp_Circ circ = adaptor.Circle();
00265 //                      c = circ.Position();
00266                         r = circ.Radius();
00267                         axis = circ.Axis();
00268                         //p1 = adaptor.Value ( adaptor.FirstParameter() );
00269                         //p2 = adaptor.Value ( adaptor.LastParameter() );
00270 //                      storeArcByPosition(c);
00271                         storeArcByRadius ( r );
00272                         storeArcByAxis ( axis );
00273                 }
00274         }
00275 }
00276 
00277 //sorts an arc into a bin, based on its radius and radiusTol
00278 void shapeInfo::storeArcByRadius ( Standard_Real r )
00279 {
00280         bool notFound = true;
00281         for ( uint n = 0 ; notFound && n < arcsByRadius.size() ; n++ )
00282         {
00283                 if ( abs ( r - arcsByRadius[n].r ) < radiusTol )
00284                 {
00285                         arcsByRadius[n].i++;
00286                         notFound = false;
00287                 }
00288         }
00289         if (notFound)
00290         {
00291                 arcRadiusBin bin;
00292                 bin.r = r;
00293                 bin.i = 1;
00294                 arcsByRadius.push_back(bin);
00295         }
00296 }
00297 
00298 //sort an arc into a bin, based on its axis and ax1*Tol
00299 void shapeInfo::storeArcByAxis ( gp_Ax1 axis )
00300 {
00301         bool notFound = true;
00302         for ( uint n = 0 ; notFound && n < arcsByAxis.size() ; n++ )
00303         {
00304                 if ( axis.IsCoaxial( arcsByAxis[n].a, ax1AngTol, ax1LinTol ) )
00305                 {
00306                         arcsByAxis[n].i++;
00307                         notFound = false;
00308                 }
00309         }
00310         if (notFound)
00311         {
00312                 arcAxisBin bin;
00313                 bin.a = axis;
00314                 bin.i = 1;
00315                 arcsByAxis.push_back(bin);
00316         }
00317 }
00318 
00319 void shapeInfo::printBinningResults()
00320 {
00321         int rBins = arcsByRadius.size();
00322         int aBins = arcsByAxis.size();
00323         QString str = "<H2>Binning results</H2><hl><H3>By Radius:</H3><br>";
00324         str += QString("%1 bins<br>").arg(rBins);
00325         for( int n = 0; n < rBins; n++ )
00326         {
00327                 str += QString("Bin %1: %2 arcs, radius %3<br>").arg(n).arg(arcsByRadius[n].i).arg(arcsByRadius[n].r);
00328         }
00329         str += "<br><H3>By Axis:</H3><br>";
00330         str += QString("%1 bins<br>").arg(aBins);
00331         for( int n = 0; n < aBins; n++ )
00332         {
00333                 str += QString("Bin %1: %2 arcs, with axis passing through point ").arg(n).arg(arcsByAxis[n].i);
00334                 str += toString(arcsByAxis[n].a.Location());
00335                 str += " in direction ";
00336                 str += toString(arcsByAxis[n].a.Direction());
00337                 str += ".<br>";
00338         }
00339         arcsByRadius.clear();
00340         arcsByAxis.clear();
00341         cout << str.toStdString() << endl;
00342         //longMsg(str);
00343 }

00346 void shapeInfo::infoButton()
00347 {
00348         getSelection();
00349         for ( uint i=0;i < selectedShapes.size();i++ )
00350         {
00351                 TopoDS_Shape S = selectedShapes[i];
00352                 switch ( S.ShapeType() )
00353                 {
00354                         case TopAbs_VERTEX :
00355                                 vertexInfo ( TopoDS::Vertex ( S ) );
00356                                 break;
00357                         case TopAbs_EDGE :
00358                                 edgeInfo ( TopoDS::Edge ( S ) );
00359                                 break;
00360                         case TopAbs_FACE :
00361                                 faceInfo ( TopoDS::Face ( S ) );
00362                                 break;
00363                         case TopAbs_SOLID :
00364                                 solidInfo ( TopoDS::Solid ( S ) );
00365                                 break;
00366                         default:
00367                                 debugMsg ( "Warning - reached default case when testing the shape's type.",__FILE__,__LINE__ );
00368                 }
00369         }
00370 }

00373 void shapeInfo::vertexInfo ( TopoDS_Vertex V )
00374 {
00375         QString s = "Vertex XYZ: " + toString ( BRep_Tool::Pnt ( V ) );
00376         infoMsg ( s );
00377 }

00379 /*
00380 **
00381 **  Tell the user about the solid that is selected.
00382 **  TODO: more info (bbox coords & volume, number of faces, number of edges, ...)
00383 **
00384 */
00385 void shapeInfo::solidInfo ( TopoDS_Solid S )
00386 {
00387         GProp_GProps System;
00388         BRepGProp::VolumeProperties ( S,System );
00389         gp_Pnt G = System.CentreOfMass ();
00390         QString s = QString ( "Solid selected. Center of mass: %1\nVolume: %2"
00391                             ).arg ( toString ( G ) ).arg ( System.Mass() );
00392         infoMsg ( s );
00393 }
00394 
00395 /*
00396 **
00397 **  Tell the user about the face that is selected.
00398 **  TODO: number of edges, area, test if it is a section of a
00399 **  cylinder, plane, or sphere (i.e. easily machined with proper mill bit)
00400 **  examine neighbors
00401 **
00402 */
00403 void shapeInfo::faceInfo ( TopoDS_Face F )
00404 {
00405 
00406         /*
00407         **  from forum: "Developing the idea of Rob, I suggest that you compute
00408         **  principal axes of inertia of your shape using BRepGProp functions,
00409         **  and transform the shape from that system before computing bnd box."
00410         **  VolumeProperties (const TopoDS_Shape &S, GProp_GProps &VProps, const Standard_Boolean OnlyClosed=Standard_False)
00411         */
00412 
00413         Bnd_Box aBox;
00414         Standard_Real aXmin, aYmin, aZmin, aXmax, aYmax, aZmax;
00415         BRepAdaptor_Surface aSurf ( F );
00416         BndLib_AddSurface::Add ( aSurf, ( Standard_Real ) 0.0,aBox );
00417         aBox.Get ( aXmin,aYmin,aZmin, aXmax,aYmax,aZmax );
00418         QString s = QString( "Selected a face. X extents %1, %2.\n" ).arg( aXmin ).arg( aXmax );
00419         s += QString( "Y extents %1, %2. " ).arg( aYmin ).arg( aYmax );
00420         s += QString( "Z extents %1, %2." ).arg( aZmin ).arg( aZmax );
00421         QString surf = "\nSurface Type: ";
00422 
00423         gp_Cylinder cyl;
00424         gp_Ax3 ax;
00425         gp_Cone cone;
00426         gp_Sphere sphere;
00427         switch (aSurf.GetType())
00428         {
00429         case GeomAbs_Plane:
00430                 surf += "plane. Passes through ";
00431                 ax = aSurf.Plane().Position();
00432                 surf += toString(ax.Location());
00433                 surf += ", normal to direction ";
00434                 surf += toString(ax.Direction());
00435                 break;
00436 
00437         case GeomAbs_Cylinder:
00438                 surf += "cylinder with symmetry axis ";
00439                 cyl = aSurf.Cylinder();
00440                 surf += toString(cyl.Axis().Direction());
00441                 surf += "\nand location ";
00442                 surf += toString(cyl.Axis().Location());
00443                 surf += QString(". Radius %1").arg(cyl.Radius());
00444                 break;
00445 
00446         case GeomAbs_Cone:
00447                 surf += "cone with symmetry axis ";
00448                 cone = aSurf.Cone();
00449                 surf += toString(cone.Axis().Direction());
00450                 surf += QString("\nand radius %1").arg(cone.RefRadius());
00451                 surf += " at location: ";
00452                 surf += toString(cone.Location());
00453                 surf += QString(". Angle %1").arg((180.0/M_PI) * cone.SemiAngle());
00454                 break;
00455 
00456         case GeomAbs_Sphere:
00457                 surf += "sphere with radius ";
00458                 sphere = aSurf.Sphere();
00459                 surf += QString(". Centered on %1").arg(sphere.Radius()) + toString(sphere.Location());
00460                 break;
00461 
00462         case GeomAbs_Torus:
00463                 surf += "torus";
00465                 break;
00466 
00467         case GeomAbs_BezierSurface:
00468                 surf += "bezier";
00469                 break;
00470 
00471         case GeomAbs_BSplineSurface:
00472                 surf += "bspline";
00473                 break;
00474 
00475         case GeomAbs_SurfaceOfRevolution:
00476                 surf += "revolution";
00478                 break;
00479 
00480         case GeomAbs_SurfaceOfExtrusion:
00481                 surf += "extrusion";
00482                 break;
00483 
00484         case GeomAbs_OffsetSurface:
00485                 surf += "offset";
00486                 break;
00487         default:
00488                 surf += "Unknown type (!)";
00489         }
00490 
00491         s += surf + ".";
00492         infoMsg ( s );
00493 }
00494 
00495 /*
00496 **  copied from cam-occ/qt3
00497 **  There are two ways to go from  a TopoDS entity to a form
00498 **  where basics like center of a circle can be extracted.
00499 **  We mix them since BRepTool does not test shape type and
00500 **  the entity types returned by BRepAdaptor do not provide
00501 **  a method to turn parameters into points.
00502 */
00503 void shapeInfo::edgeInfo ( TopoDS_Edge E )
00504 {
00505         Standard_Real first, last;
00506         gp_Pnt p1,p2,c;
00507 
00508 //we don't (yet) change the position of the part in camocc2, so skip the transform...
00509 //        BRepBuilderAPI_Transform trsf(E,Part.GetAxis());
00510 //        TopoDS_Edge Et=TopoDS::Edge(trsf.Shape());
00511 
00512         Handle ( Geom_Curve ) C = BRep_Tool::Curve ( E,first,last );
00513         BRepAdaptor_Curve adaptor = BRepAdaptor_Curve ( E );
00514         QString s;
00515         if ( adaptor.GetType() ==GeomAbs_Circle )
00516         {
00517                 gp_Circ circ = adaptor.Circle();
00518                 c = circ.Location();
00519                 Standard_Real R = circ.Radius();
00520                 s = QString ( "Center of that arc: %1; Radius: %2" ).arg ( toString ( c ) ).arg ( R );
00521         }
00522         else if ( adaptor.GetType() ==GeomAbs_Line )
00523         {
00525                 s = "Line";
00526         }
00527         else s = "Edge";
00528         p1=C->Value ( first );
00529         p2=C->Value ( last );
00530         s += QString ( "\nFirst point %1\nLast point %2" ).arg ( toString ( p1 ) ).arg ( toString ( p2 ) );
00531         infoMsg ( s );
00532 }
